inclusion.criterion: approximately 1-2 weeks prior to her expected date of follow up, for a preliminary conversation and invited to participate in the study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: After verbal telephonic consent is obtained, she will be interviewed by the clinical research nurse using the format of the prepared proforma (Form A) regarding symptoms suggestive of disease recurrence as well as treatment induced toxicity.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: When the patient reports to the OPD the next week for scheduled physical follow up, the nurse completes the consenting process by taking a short written informed consent.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: In addition at the physical visit, information regarding the acceptability of nurse-led telephonic follow-up to the patient and the financial impact of physical follow- up will be collected using a structured format (Form C).
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with Stage III disease treated with palliative intent with once monthly radiotherapy.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Early stage cervical cancer patients who underwent Wertheims hysterectomy and who have completed adjuvant radiochemotherapy due to high-risk factors.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Patients who are unable to comprehend the questions or dialogue over telephone by medical staff.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Patients who seem unreliable for follow up.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: 16-year-old girl recently diagnosed with myasthenia gravis, class IIa. She complains of diplopia and weakness affecting in her upper extremities.
